text:
What's up everybody, welcome back to Vagabrothers
and welcome back to Helsinki, where we've
been speaking at the Nordic Bloggers' Exchange.

It's been a crazy week meeting up with some
other travel bloggers as well as some of our
Finnish friends and fans. So here's the story
[Intro sounds]

Making a travel show on the internet is weird
and wonderful thing. Although we're from California,

our biggest audience after the USA is right
here in Finland.

That's because last year, we spent two weeks
traveling from Lapland to Helsinki, and getting

our first taste of Finland. We loved what
we discovered and we tried to share that with
you through this channel.

Enter a Finnish YouTuber named Miisa, who
discovered our videos on Finland and shared

them with her subscribers, bringing the average latitude
of our viewers way far north.

So when we were invited to Helsinki to speak
about travel video at the Nordic Blogger's

Exchange, we saw it as a great opportunity
to meet some of fans and new friends from
the internet, starting with Miisa.

So we're in Helsinki and we're on our way
to go meet up with our Finnish friend, Miisa.

Should be cool. We only know her in Internet-Land
so it will be fun to see her in person.

And get a coffee. Because it's, as you can
see, snowing.

And Finns like coffee so it's a good place
to get coffee.
Guys, look who we found - it's Miisa!
And Tuomas! How are you guys doing today?
Supposedly this is warm weather. Is this warm?
This is very warm.

It was great to finally meet Miisa in person
and we hope to do some more adventures with

her soon. We warmed up over coffee, snapped
a quick photo, and then rolled back to the
hotel to meet some of our Finnish fans.
Three, two, one...
"Welcome to Finland"

So after that, we headed to the welcoming
part for the Nordic Bloggers' Exchange, which

brought together Finnish bloggers and other
travel bloggers from around the world.
Hey, cheers!
Cheers!

The next day, the conference organized a fun
challenge - a scavenger hunt across Helsinki.

Alright, so it's like nine in the morning
in Helsinki Finland...

...and we're going on a scavenger hunt with
the rest of the other bloggers from the trip,
so...
It's called the Amazing Race
Should be pretty fun, so let's go

Inside, we were split into teams and given
a bag of wooden puzzle pieces, that, when
assembled, were miniatures of Helsinki landmarks.

The goal: correctly assemble pieces, identify
the landmarks, and then snap a selfie in front
of each one. First team team finished wins.

Keith is really smart and he figured out a
good idea.

So I googled this - Helsinki Design Capital
building blocks

And in the meantime I've taken a photo of
the pieces and tweeted it out on Twitter so

hopefully our Finnish fans will help us find
out what this is about.

Luckily, our tweet was spotted by another
Finnish YouTuber, Timo Wilderness, who tweeted
us the answers we needed to start the race.
Ready, set, go!

Alright, so we've been at if for five minutes
and we've already got two out of, I think,

six landmarks. So if we keep up this pace,
we just might win this thing.

So the Amazing Race continues, we've got about
half of the clues already, and now we're showing

up to the Helsinki Senate [Square] to get
one of the last few so we're doing well, hopefully
we're going to win this one.

But even though we felt we knew the city well,
we didn't know all the landmarks so we asked
a local for help
We are now here... right, oh yeah.

You gotta love it, the locals here are so
friendly
Can I help you? Yeah!

Just stop somebody on the street, take ten
minutes of there time asking - where are we?

We wanna go here, we wanna go there. But gotta
love Helsinki.

The scavenger hunt took onwards to Parliament,
the long bridge, and finally to the Olympic
Stadium where the race finished.

Well, we just finished the scavenger hunt,
I think we got all of them.
I don't think we did...

Thanks to all the people who helped us on
Twitter. Now we're going into the conference,

where we're going to be talking on video blogging
and travel. It should be fun.

It was the first time we'd given a talk on
how to do travel video, and it was really

cool to share the experiences and knowledge
we've got over the last two years.

We are at the NBE Nordic Bloggers Exchange
conference and we're teaching this whole class

right here about vlogging and travel video
so I'm now giving them a demonstration on
how to vlog.

So what do you guys think? You learning things?
You ready to make travel videos? So hopefully

they will make some good channels, and if
we find some of these good channels we'll
send them to you guys too.

We even got 40 people vlogging for the first
time, at the same time, all in one room. Hectic!

Alright, so our Vlogging 101 class is going
well. Sebastian, what's up? What's your channel?
My channel is Sebastian Canaves, with a C

Alright, we'll link it in the info box. If
you sprechen sie Deutsch you should check
it out because he's a German daily vlogger.

In the evening after the conference, our Finnish
hosts told us they'd organized a special treat
just outside of Helsinki.

Ok so the conference is over for the day,
Alex went home early because he's waking up

to shoot some cool photography tomorrow with
one of our buddies, but I'm here with the

rest of the bloggers and we're going to learn
a few things about the Finnish sauna experience.

Ok to clarify, Finns go in saunas naked but
there's absolutely nothing sexual about it.

Either way though, everyone's from other countries
and so our Finnish hosts suggested that we
keep our clothes on.

I spent a couple hours going in and out of
the different saunas, but no sauna is complete
without an icy swim.

So we're on the edge of this dock, the lake
is frozen, and according to the old dudes

from the Finnish Sauna Society, this the only
way to counter a hot time in the steam room.
Don't look down here, don't film down here.
How do you feel that? That after sauna feeling
It feels like sex, like after sex.
Sex is better... sex is worse than this!
And sex in the sauna - double good!
But if you can do both...
...that's perfect!

The next morning, I woke up and met up with
Kontsa Punkka, a talented Finnish wildlife

photographer who I've been following on Instagram
for a while.

Alright guys so I just met up with my friend
Konsta Punkka
Hello!

If you haven't checked out his Instagram,
it's Kpunkka... we'll link it in the bottom.

He's the squirrel whisperer and today he's
going to show us how he does his thing.

Alright, so we've just arrived. Where are
we?
We're in Seurasaari Island

Ok, it's like 15 minutes outside of Helsinki.
It's super quiet, no?
Yeah, it's mid-week, so no people around.
But lots of bird and squirrel friends?
Yeah, lots of those.
How did you start doing this?

I was here running, and I heard that there
are a few birds and squirrels that are pretty

tame, so I started to come here and take my
camera with me and started giving them some

peanuts and they got really used to me, and
that's how it goes. By accident.
Well that was quick. Wow!

Konsta is going to show us...maybe if we're
lucky we can get a fox, we've already gotten

a couple of birds, but we still need to get
a squirrel. So let's do it.
God, you guys, this is so somesome.

These are super delicious nuts, I can see
why the birds and squirrels like you so much.

I'm starting to like you too, man. Thanks
for these snacks!
Oh my god, this is awesome!
Nice!
Dude, that was so much fun!
Thanks for taking me out here.
Yeah, that was a fun time.

So if you guys want to check out more of Konsta's
work go onto Instagram - Kpunkka. That's it.

So check out the photos we shot together and
check out the photos we shot on Instagram.

It was a fun week here in Helsinki, meeting
other creators, other travel bloggers and
of course meeting you guys.

We really love Finland, we want to come back
and we want to explore more of the Nordic

region in general, so tell us where you want
us to go, leave us your comments, and we'll
try to plan our trip around your tips.

As always, if you've enjoyed the video make
sure you give it a thumbs up, share it with

your friends and subscribe for new travel
videos every Tuesdayy.

And don't forget, this trip is going all around
Europe this winter by train so follow us on
the new app Storie, download it and add "Vagabrothers"
